prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Eddie Fender
Description: A student working part-time at the offices of Edgeworth and Co. Studying to be an attorney.
Character 1
Name: Samson Tangaroa
Description: My client, and a man said to be the greatest confectioner of his generation.
Character 2
Name: Artie Frost
Description: The murder victim. Found dead inside Samson Tangaroa's chocolate work.
Character 3
Name: Judy Bound
Description: Assistant to Samson Tangaroa. She's fond of the work of sculptor Paul Halique.
Character 4
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: The detective assigned to this case. A man of few words.
Character 5
Name: Carmelo Gusto
Description: A candy-crafting confectioner who's taking part in the contest.
Character 6
Name: Delicia Scone
Description: A confectioner who will do whatever it takes to achieve her goals.
Character 7
Name: Manfred von Karma
Description: The prosecutor in charge of this case. It is said that he has never lost a trial in these past 25 years.
Character 8
Name: Laurice Deauxnim
Description: Pseudonym of Larry Butz, my friend since childhood. He fancies himself as something of an artist.
Character 9
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective from the local precinct who's always first on the scene at any murder investigation.
Character 10
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: A self-styled Great Thief and so-called "second Yatagarasu" who's always looking to bag the greatest treasure of all -- the truth.
Character 11
Name: Verity Gavèlle
Description: A district court judge and member of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence, who also acts as its mouthpiece.
Character 12
Name: Eustace Winner
Description: The greatest prosecutor ever to prosecute... according to himself, anyway. In actual fact, his relationship with logic is tenuous at best.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. Polishing it every day has become just another part of my daily routine.
Evidence 1
Name: Seal
Description: A seal that was found near the body when it was discovered. What could the design signify?
Evidence 2
Name: Crime Scene Notes
Description: Notes about the crime scene. The police have taken custody of the body.
Evidence 3
Name: Mr. Tangaroa's Teapot
Description: A Paul Halique piece with Tangaroa's fingerprints on it.
Evidence 4
Name: Contest Rules
Description: A piece of paper listing the rules for the contest.
Evidence 5
Name: Frame Finger Marks
Description: Someone left finger marks on the chocolate frame, but didn't leave any prints.
Evidence 6
Name: Mansion Key
Description: The one and only key that unlocks every door in the mansion. Tangaroa was in possession of it the entire time.
Evidence 7
Name: Salt Lamp
Description: Salt lamp found in Scone's room. Stained with the victim's blood.
Evidence 8
Name: Fake Confections
Description: Ms. Scone's so-called creations were all fake plastic models, covered in a thick layer of whipped cream.
Evidence 9
Name: Luminous Cloth
Description: Special color-changing cloth belonging to Scone. She has lost a roll of it, along with the device that powers it.
Evidence 10
Name: Chocolates
Description: Tangaroa's favorite, handmade by Bound. Rather misshapened, and incredibly sweet.
Evidence 11
Name: Instant Camera
Description: Takes photos that develop instantly. A new film cartridge has twenty exposures, but there are only three remaining.
Evidence 12
Name: Mr. Frost's Room
Description: A photo of Frost's sculptures, taken by Judy Bound. Two photos, one from Bound and one from Detective Badd.
Evidence 13
Name: Ms. Scone's Statement
Description: Frost's sculptures in the finals were "scrumptious", except for the lyre, which was salty.
Evidence 14
Name: Semifinal Entries
Description: Frost's and Gusto's creations had different designs, but tasted the same.
Evidence 15
Name: Ultimate Cookbook
Description: A book containing formulas for creating a cure for taste disorders and other chemical and pharmaceutical items.
Evidence 16
Name: Victim's Blood
Description: Frost's blood was found in the fountain, but not at the scene of the crime.
Evidence 17
Name: Family Photo
Description: A photo of Frost, Gusto, and their sons. Gusto's son visited his father daily up through the semifinal.
Evidence 18
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 19
Name: IS-7 Incident Case File
Description: Documents providing an overview of the IS-7 Incident. Documents received from Fender, including his comments in red.
Evidence 20
Name: Gallery Pamphlet
Description: A pamphlet received upon entry to the gallery.
Evidence 21
Name: Winter Wing Photo
Description: Statues matching those made by the victim eighteen years ago.
Evidence 22
Name: Pisces Statue Sketch
Description: A sketch by Larry depicting the Pisces statue exactly as he saw it.
Evidence 23
Name: Used Blowtorch
Description: There are signs it was used just before the police arrived. Possibly to heat something?
Evidence 24
Name: Luminous Cloth
Description: Cloth that glows when connected to a full-spectrum light-emitting device. Delicia Scone's property. One of these was lost eighteen years ago. Given to Bound by Scone. Lost eighteen years ago, only to be rediscovered floating in the fountain.
Evidence 25
Name: Poison Gas Ingredients
Description: The gas was produced when bright red Ubiquium and pure white Asphyxion were mixed together.
Evidence 26
Name: Ultimate Cookbook
Description: A book containing formulas for creating a cure for taste disorders and other chemical and pharmaceutical items.
Evidence 27
Name: Frame Finger Marks
Description: Finger marks left by someone in Tangaroa's room. No accompanying prints.
Evidence 28
Name: Salt Lamp
Description: A photograph of the murder weapon from the IS-7 Incident. It's a salt lamp stained with Frost's blood.
Evidence 29
Name: Family Photo
Description: A photo of Frost, Gusto, and their sons. Gusto's son visited his father daily up through the semifinal.
Evidence 30
Name: Teapot
Description: Designed by Paul Halique. One of Judy Bound's prize possessions.
Evidence 31
Name: Ceramic Fragment
Description: Found in a puddle of tea. The design looks familiar.
Evidence 32
Name: Lift Cart
Description: Used by Frost to transport ice eighteen years ago. The top of the platform is wet.
Evidence 33
Name: Larry's Sketches
Description: Sketches depicting exactly what Larry saw.
Evidence 34
Name: Gemini Case Analysis Results
Description: Results of the analysis conducted on the melted contents of the Gemini case. [info] Detected: Salt, Sugar, Blood

Sugar composition matches that of sugar found in the pale blue liquid in Artie Frost's room eighteen years ago.

Sugar detected in fountain water also seems to be a match.
Evidence 35
Name: Chocolates
Description: Handmade by Bound. Slightly melted after being kept in her pocket.
Evidence 36
Name: Statute of Limitations
Description: A book explaining the statutes of limitations of various crimes. [info] There are several conditions under which the time limit can be put on hold and extended:
If a suspect goes to a foreign country, then the time limit is put on hold until they return.
If any possible accomplices are put on trial, then the time limit is put on hold until the accomplice's verdict is reached.
If charges are pressed to demand compensation, then the time limit is put on hold until this procedure is cleared up.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Gusto and Frost's relationship?
Person: von Karma
Testimony 1
Testimony: It's obvious the only relationship they had was that they happened to participate in the same contest.
Person: von Karma

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
The contradiction lies between the evidence showing a personal relationship between Gusto and Frost and the testimony denying any relationship besides contest participation.

Evidence 29 (Family Photo) shows Frost, Gusto, and their sons, indicating a personal connection outside of the contest. This suggests they had a familial or close relationship, as Gusto’s son visited his father daily.

Testimony 1 by von Karma states: "It's obvious the only relationship they had was that they happened to participate in the same contest," which denies any other connection.

Therefore, the family photo evidence contradicts von Karma’s testimony claiming no relationship beyond the contest.

Evidence 36
Name: Statute of Limitations

If a suspect goes to a foreign country, then the time limit is put on hold until they return.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: If you want to know about Gusto and Frost's connection so badly, I'll tell you.
Person: von Karma
Testimony 1
Testimony: Last night, when I interrogated Gusto, he told me about his connection with Frost.
Person: von Karma
Testimony 2
Testimony: Until the day before the finals, they worked on their desserts together.
Person: von Karma
Testimony 3
Testimony: Why? Because Gusto had poor design sense, and Frost was a novice at baking.
Person: von Karma
Testimony 4
Testimony: Their cooperation lasted only through the semifinals. For the finals, they were on their own.
Person: von Karma

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Evidence 14 states that Frost's and Gusto's creations for the semifinals had different designs but tasted the same, suggesting that they were working closely together at least up to the semifinals.

Testimony 3 claims that Gusto had poor design sense and Frost was a novice at baking. This could imply a division of labor rather than close cooperation, which somewhat aligns with Evidence 14.

Testimony 2 says "Until the day before the finals, they worked on their desserts together," implying cooperation continued beyond the semifinals.

Testimony 4 says "Their cooperation lasted only through the semifinals. For the finals, they were on their own," which aligns with evidence 14's mention of semifinals but conflicts with testimony 2, not evidence.

Therefore, the only direct conflicting pair between evidence and testimony could be the interpretation of the duration or nature of their cooperation; but evidence 14 supports the semifinals cooperation.

However, testimonial evidence from von Karma (1) "Last night, when I interrogated Gusto, he told me about his connection with Frost" and evidence 17/29 "Family Photo" shows Frost, Gusto, and their sons, and that Gusto's son visited his father daily up through the semifinal.

Not very contradictory.

In the evidences, Evidence 7 (Salt Lamp stained with victim's blood found in Scone's room) and Evidence 28 (a photo of the salt lamp from the IS-7 Incident) showing it as murder weapon, might contrast with a statement or testimony that Scone was innocent, but no testimony saying this directly.

So looking again:

Testimony 4 (by von Karma): Their cooperation lasted only through the semifinals.

Evidence 2: Crime scene notes relevant.

Not conflicting.

Testimony 2: Until the day before the finals, they worked on their desserts together.

Conflict with Testimony 4 (both from von Karma) but not with evidence.

Looking more:

Evidence 16: Victim's blood found in fountain, but not at scene.

Salt Lamp with blood in Scone's room (Evidence 7).

Evidence 8: Ms Scone's creations were fake and covered with whipped cream.

Testimony 13: Ms Scone's statement said the lyre sculpture was salty.

No direct conflict.

Evidence 5: Finger marks on chocolate frame but no prints.

Evidence 27: Finger marks on frame in Tangaroa's room, no prints.

Same presumably, no contradiction.

In sum, the strongest contradiction seems between:

Testimony 2: "Until the day before the finals, they worked on their desserts together."

Testimony 4: "Their cooperation lasted only through the semifinals."

Both from von Karma, but contradictory.

But the prompt requires to provide a pair between evidence and testimony, so only considers evidence and testimony.

Therefore, let's check for a contradiction between Evidence 14 and one of these testimonies.

Evidence 14 states: Final creations different design but same taste.

That matches with cooperation until the semifinals, but testimony 2 says cooperation until before finals (which is just before finals).

So this means they cooperated beyond semifinals.

Hence, testimony 2 ("until day before finals") contradicts the implication of Evidence 14 that cooperation ended at semifinals.

Therefore, Evidence 14 and Testimony 2 contradict each other.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: 18 years after Monsieur Master was arrested, I was finally able to buy back this mansion.
Person: Kate
Testimony 1
Testimony: Then, in order to maintain it, I decided to manage it as an art gallery.
Person: Kate
Testimony 2
Testimony: I collected Pierre Hoquet's works from all over the world.
Person: Kate
Testimony 3
Testimony: After all, it was my dream to open the Zodiac Art Gallery.
Person: Kate
Testimony 4
Testimony: I prepared replicas of the sculptures in the Winter Palace based on the photos I took.
Person: Kate

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Testimony 0 states that "18 years after Monsieur Master was arrested, I was finally able to buy back this mansion." This implies the mansion was not accessible or owned by Kate for the whole period before this event of buying it back.

Evidence 24 states that the Luminous Cloth was lost eighteen years ago and has now been rediscovered floating in the fountain. This suggests that the cloth (a key piece of property) has some historical and physical ties to the mansion or related events 18 years ago.

If the mansion was only bought back 18 years after the arrest, it would be contradictory if items linked to events exactly 18 years ago were still present and undiscovered in the mansion prior to Kate's ownership. This raises a question about the timing and possession of the mansion relative to the discovery of the cloth.

Therefore, these two are contradictory because the testimony suggests Kate could only gain possession of the mansion 18 years after the arrest, while the evidence implies the mansion contained artifacts tied to events 18 years ago and thus might have been in her possession or accessed before that.

Evidence 2
Name: Crime Scene Notes
Description: Notes about the crime scene. The police have taken custody of the body.
Evidence 3
Name: Mr. Tangaroa's Teapot
Description: A Paul Halique piece with Tangaroa's fingerprints on it.
Evidence 4
Name: Contest Rules
Description: A piece of paper listing the rules for the contest.
Evidence 5
Name: Frame Finger Marks
Description: Someone left finger marks on the chocolate frame, but didn't leave any prints.
Evidence 6
Name: Mansion Key
Description: The one and only key that unlocks every door in the mansion. Tangaroa was in possession of it the entire time.
Evidence 7
Name: Salt Lamp
Description: Salt lamp found in Scone's room. Stained with the victim's blood.
Evidence 8
Name: Fake Confections
Description: Ms. Scone's so-called creations were all fake plastic models, covered in a thick layer of whipped cream.
Evidence 9
Name: Luminous Cloth
Description: Special color-changing cloth belonging to Scone. She has lost a roll of it, along with the device that powers it.
Evidence 10
Name: Chocolates
Description: Tangaroa's favorite, handmade by Bound. Rather misshapened, and incredibly sweet.
Evidence 11
Name: Instant Camera
Description: Takes photos that develop instantly. A new film cartridge has twenty exposures, but there are only three remaining.
Evidence 12
Name: Mr. Frost's Room
Description: A photo of Frost's sculptures, taken by Judy Bound. Two photos, one from Bound and one from Detective Badd.
Evidence 13
Name: Ms. Scone's Statement
Description: Frost's sculptures in the finals were "scrumptious", except for the lyre, which was salty.
Evidence 14
Name: Semifinal Entries
Description: Frost's and Gusto's creations had different designs, but tasted the same.
Evidence 15
Name: Ultimate Cookbook
Description: A book containing formulas for creating a cure for taste disorders and other chemical and pharmaceutical items.
Evidence 16
Name: Victim's Blood
Description: Frost's blood was found in the fountain, but not at the scene of the crime.
Evidence 17
Name: Family Photo
Description: A photo of Frost, Gusto, and their sons. Gusto's son visited his father daily up through the semifinal.
Evidence 18
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 19
Name: IS-7 Incident Case File
Description: Documents providing an overview of the IS-7 Incident. Documents received from Fender, including his comments in red.
Evidence 20
Name: Gallery Pamphlet
Description: A pamphlet received upon entry to the gallery.
Evidence 21
Name: Winter Wing Photo
Description: Statues matching those made by the victim eighteen years ago.
Evidence 22
Name: Pisces Statue Sketch
Description: A sketch by Larry depicting the Pisces statue exactly as he saw it.
Evidence 23
Name: Used Blowtorch
Description: There are signs it was used just before the police arrived. Possibly to heat something?
Evidence 24
Name: Luminous Cloth
Description: Cloth that glows when connected to a full-spectrum light-emitting device. Delicia Scone's property. One of these was lost eighteen years ago. Given to Bound by Scone. Lost eighteen years ago, only to be rediscovered floating in the fountain.
Evidence 25
Name: Poison Gas Ingredients
Description: The gas was produced when bright red Ubiquium and pure white Asphyxion were mixed together.
Evidence 26
Name: Ultimate Cookbook
Description: A book containing formulas for creating a cure for taste disorders and other chemical and pharmaceutical items.
Evidence 27
Name: Frame Finger Marks
Description: Finger marks left by someone in Tangaroa's room. No accompanying prints.
Evidence 28
Name: Salt Lamp
Description: A photograph of the murder weapon from the IS-7 Incident. It's a salt lamp stained with Frost's blood.
Evidence 29
Name: Family Photo
Description: A photo of Frost, Gusto, and their sons. Gusto's son visited his father daily up through the semifinal.
Evidence 30
Name: Teapot
Description: Designed by Paul Halique. One of Judy Bound's prize possessions.
Evidence 31
Name: Ceramic Fragment
Description: Found in a puddle of tea. The design looks familiar.
Evidence 32
Name: Lift Cart
Description: Used by Frost to transport ice eighteen years ago. The top of the platform is wet.
Evidence 33
Name: Larry's Sketches
Description: Sketches depicting exactly what Larry saw.
Evidence 34
Name: Gemini Case Analysis Results
Description: Results of the analysis conducted on the melted contents of the Gemini case. [info] Detected: Salt, Sugar, Blood

Sugar composition matches that of sugar found in the pale blue liquid in Artie Frost's room eighteen years ago.

Sugar detected in fountain water also seems to be a match.
Evidence 35
Name: Chocolates
Description: Handmade by Bound. Slightly melted after being kept in her pocket.
Evidence 36
Name: Statute of Limitations
Description: A book explaining the statutes of limitations of various crimes. [info] There are several conditions under which the time limit can be put on hold and extended:
If a suspect goes to a foreign country, then the time limit is put on hold until they return.
If any possible accomplices are put on trial, then the time limit is put on hold until the accomplice's verdict is reached.
If charges are pressed to demand compensation, then the time limit is put on hold until this procedure is cleared up.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Sir Frost and I cooperated until the finals. I handled the flavor, he was in charge of the design.
Person: Gusto
Testimony 1
Testimony: However, for the finals, I wanted to challenge Sir Master with my own skills.
Person: Gusto
Testimony 2
Testimony: I helped Sir Frost make his entry, but I made mine completely on my own.
Person: Gusto
Testimony 3
Testimony: If the flavor of my entry wasn't good enough, my own lack of training was to blame.
Person: Gusto
Testimony 4
Testimony: Aside from not cooperating with Sir Frost, the finals weren't much different from the semifinals.
Person: Gusto
Testimony 5
Testimony: Sir Frost's son and my own attended the same elementary school.
Person: Gusto

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Testimony 0 states that Gusto and Sir Frost cooperated until the finals with Gusto handling flavor and Frost in charge of design. However, Testimony 2 says that Gusto helped Sir Frost make his entry but made his own entry completely on his own, which slightly contradicts the extent of cooperation described in Testimony 0, particularly if the finals were as competitive as implied by Testimony 1. The contradiction mainly lies in the nature and extent of cooperation between Gusto and Frost during the finals.

None of the evidence directly contradicts these testimonies explicitly. However, looking through the evidences related to the finals and their entries:

Evidence 14 states Frost's and Gusto's creations had different designs but tasted the same, which might imply cooperation on flavor or recipe, slightly contradicting Gusto's claim in Testimony 2 of making his entry completely on his own.

Therefore, Evidence 14 and Testimony 2 contradict each other.
